findings.title: Growth analytics payload includes DOB and measurement date fields
repro_steps: Open /growth/.
Enter DOB and measurement date, then calculate.
Inspect analytics payload fields in growth.js and TinyTrack ingestion path.
findings.observed: DOB and measurement_date are serialized into analytics event payloads.
findings.expected: Potentially identifying/date-sensitive clinical inputs should be excluded or strongly minimized from analytics payloads.
findings.risk: Privacy and compliance exposure for health-adjacent user data.
findings.fix_hint: Strip DOB/date fields from analytics events and retain only coarse, non-identifying derived categories.

findings.title: Catch-up engine cannot validate dose chronology (checkbox counts only)
repro_steps: Open /catch-up/.
Note only dose checkboxes are collected per vaccine; no per-dose dates are entered.
Generate plan for a child with delayed and irregular prior timing.
findings.observed: Tool represents prior history as dose counts, not dated administrations, while advertising next-dose planning.
findings.expected: Catch-up planning should capture date-aware prior dose validity when claiming interval-sensitive planning.
findings.risk: Incorrect next-step recommendations when historical doses violate minimum intervals or age validity.
findings.fix_hint: Add per-dose date capture and validation pipeline before forecasting.

findings.title: Dosing calculator displays minimum-age notes but has no age-gating enforcement
repro_steps: Open /dosing/.
Enter weight only (no age input exists).
Observe ibuprofen/diphenhydramine dose outputs are still generated regardless of child age.
findings.observed: Minimum-age constraints exist in data (Ibuprofen (Advil/Motrin), Diphenhydramine (Benadryl)) but are not algorithmically enforced.
findings.expected: Medication outputs with age restrictions should require age input and enforce hard-stop/guardrails.
findings.risk: Unsafe dose display for age-ineligible patients.
findings.fix_hint: Add patient age input, evaluate med.minAge rules before output, and block/flag ineligible results.

findings.title: Legal positioning and clinician-targeted structured data are materially inconsistent
repro_steps: Review terms page language on medical-tool restrictions.
Review homepage JSON-LD positioning and audience targeting.
Compare normative legal statement against marketed schema role.
findings.observed: Terms disclaim medical-tool use while schema explicitly positions clinician-facing medical web application context.
findings.expected: Legal, product, and structured-data positioning should be coherent and non-contradictory.
findings.risk: Legal ambiguity and compliance exposure for intended-use representation.
findings.fix_hint: Harmonize legal language with actual product intent and schema declarations.

findings.title: "No tracking" copy conflicts with active analytics/fingerprinting stack
repro_steps: Open any calculator route showing the privacy banner.
Review shared/analytics.js initialization and tracking methods.
Compare live behavior with on-page no-tracking statement.
findings.observed: Privacy banner states no tracking while analytics script initializes multi-provider tracking and fingerprint collection.
findings.expected: Public privacy claims should accurately reflect active telemetry behavior.
findings.risk: Regulatory, legal, and trust risk due to contradictory representations.
findings.fix_hint: Align copy and policy with actual behavior or disable tracking paths that contradict current statements.

findings.title: Analytics initializes automatically with hardcoded GA fallback and no consent gate
repro_steps: Open shared/analytics.js init flow.
Confirm no consent/opt-in check before provider initialization.
Confirm GA fallback ID is hardcoded.
findings.observed: Tracking providers initialize on load with fallback GA ID and no explicit consent branch.
findings.expected: Consent-sensitive tracking should be gated and fallback IDs should not silently activate in production paths.
findings.risk: Privacy/legal exposure and uncontrolled telemetry in environments expecting opt-in behavior.
findings.fix_hint: Introduce explicit consent state gate and remove implicit hardcoded production measurement defaults.

findings.title: Do-Not-Track value is collected but not used for tracking suppression
repro_steps: Inspect deviceInfo collection in shared/analytics.js.
Search for control flow that disables tracking based on doNotTrack.
Observe that value is captured but not enforced.
findings.observed: DNT is tracked as metadata rather than used as a policy gate.
findings.expected: If DNT is represented as respected behavior, analytics init should branch accordingly.
findings.risk: Potential deceptive privacy posture and compliance risk.
findings.fix_hint: Add explicit pre-init DNT gate or remove claims implying DNT-based suppression.

findings.title: Geolocation path uses ip-api free endpoint over HTTP URL pattern in code
repro_steps: Inspect getIPGeolocation() in shared/analytics.js.
Observe fallback endpoint and provider assumptions.
Assess usage constraints/security posture for production telemetry.
findings.observed: Code defaults to free ip-api endpoint path when key is absent.
findings.expected: Production telemetry should use secure, policy-approved geolocation providers and explicit contractual limits.
findings.risk: Reliability/compliance risk and weaker transport/provider posture.
findings.fix_hint: Move geolocation behind first-party endpoint or approved provider with explicit HTTPS and governance controls.

findings.title: GA term-status thresholds are shifted from standard obstetric category boundaries
repro_steps: Open /ga-calc/.
Inspect termStatus conditional thresholds in ga-calc.js.
Compare threshold boundaries to standard term-category definitions.
findings.observed: Current day cutoffs classify term categories with late boundaries that do not align with standard bins.
findings.expected: Term classifications should map accurately to accepted gestational age bins.
findings.risk: Incorrect term-status labeling in clinical communication.
findings.fix_hint: Replace hardcoded thresholds with validated constants and add unit tests for boundary days.

findings.title: Growth chart metric-tab click path drops Fenton context and redraws via WHO/CDC path
repro_steps: Open /growth/ and run a preterm case using Fenton.
Switch chart tabs after initial calculation.
Review tab click handler: drawChart is called without useFenton argument.
findings.observed: Tab redraw path does not preserve/use Fenton mode state.
findings.expected: Preterm/Fenton mode should persist across tab interactions.
findings.risk: Visualization can misrepresent percentile context for preterm patients.
findings.fix_hint: Persist calculation context (including useFenton/fentonGaWeeks) and pass through tab redraw calls.

findings.title: Bilirubin UI accepts postnatal ages beyond available threshold curve data
repro_steps: Open /bili/ and enter postnatal age > 96h.
Compare input range to threshold data max age.
Inspect interpolation behavior at curve tail.
findings.observed: Input allows through 168h while threshold arrays top out at 96h; interpolation clamps to terminal value.
findings.expected: Input range and modeled threshold domain should remain aligned or explicitly flagged as extrapolation.
findings.risk: False confidence in late-hour threshold interpretation.
findings.fix_hint: Either constrain accepted age to supported data range or add explicitly validated extended curves.

findings.title: Growth page markets BMI-for-age support but calculator does not implement BMI path
repro_steps: Read growth page metadata/FAQ claims for BMI-for-age.
Inspect growth.js metric branches and chart tabs.
Confirm no BMI input/calculation/visualization branch exists.
findings.observed: Public copy includes BMI-for-age language while runtime only computes weight/length/HC.
findings.expected: Public capability statements should match implemented calculator behavior.
findings.risk: Clinical expectation mismatch and misleading feature claims.
findings.fix_hint: Either implement BMI-for-age calculations and UI or remove BMI claims from metadata/content.

findings.title: wrangler.toml and staging-wrangler.toml resolve to same project name
repro_steps: Open wrangler.toml and staging-wrangler.toml.
Compare name values.
Review deploy script workflow that swaps wrangler config files in-place.
findings.observed: Both config files currently target "tinyhumanmd-staging" with in-place config mutation in deploy flow.
findings.expected: Environment configs should clearly separate targets and avoid mutable swap-side effects.
findings.risk: Accidental environment cross-deploy and operator error.
findings.fix_hint: Use explicit project separation and deploy commands without mutable config swaps.

findings.title: Staging headers confirm one-year immutable cache policy on unversioned JS asset
repro_steps: Request https://staging.tinyhumanmd.pages.dev/shared/analytics.js and inspect cache-control headers.
Compare header policy with non-hashed asset naming strategy.
findings.observed: Runtime response applies long immutable cache policy to stable filename asset.
findings.expected: Immutable caching should accompany content-hashed/versioned asset paths.
findings.risk: Delayed clinical logic propagation due to cache stickiness.
findings.fix_hint: Introduce versioned asset strategy before retaining immutable 1y cache semantics.

findings.title: Bilirubin chart x-axis cap (100h) conflicts with UI input range (0-168h)
repro_steps: Open /bili/ and enter age >100h.
Generate chart and inspect patient point visibility/scaling.
Review chart x-axis hard cap in bili.js.
findings.observed: Chart axis truncates at 100h despite accepted inputs through 168h.
findings.expected: Visualization domain should cover accepted input domain or enforce stricter input limits.
findings.risk: User-facing graph may clip or misrepresent entered values.
findings.fix_hint: Synchronize axis bounds with validated input limits and threshold data range.

findings.title: Security header baseline missing CSP and HSTS directives in _headers
repro_steps: Open _headers policy file.
Check for Content-Security-Policy and Strict-Transport-Security directives.
Compare to expected hardened baseline for health-adjacent tooling.
findings.observed: Current header policy includes basic headers but omits CSP and HSTS directives.
findings.expected: Production header baseline should include CSP and HSTS (where deployment supports HTTPS-only).
findings.risk: Increased attack surface and weaker browser-enforced hardening.
findings.fix_hint: Add CSP and HSTS directives with staged rollout/testing to avoid breaking required assets.

findings.title: Long immutable caching is applied to unversioned JS/CSS asset names
repro_steps: Review _headers static asset cache rules.
Review HTML script/link tags for versioned filenames or content hashes.
Assess cache invalidation behavior for clinical logic updates.
findings.observed: Assets are cache-immutable for one year while filenames remain stable/non-hashed.
findings.expected: Immutable caching should be paired with hashed or versioned asset paths.
findings.risk: Stale clinical logic persisted in clients after important updates.
findings.fix_hint: Adopt build-time content hashing or explicit version query strategy and update cache policy accordingly.

findings.title: Metadata governance appears inconsistent across sitemap/page metadata timestamps
repro_steps: Inspect sitemap.xml lastmod values.
Compare page-level dateModified and legal effective dates.
Assess consistency of update metadata governance.
findings.observed: Cross-file metadata dates are not clearly synchronized by a single publishing workflow.
findings.expected: Sitemap/page metadata should reflect a consistent release-date governance process.
findings.fix_hint: Generate sitemap and metadata timestamps from a single release pipeline source.

findings.title: Service worker precache list is hand-maintained and drift-prone
repro_steps: Open sw.js asset list.
Compare with project file inventory and route dependencies.
Assess risk of missing/new assets not reflected in cache list.
findings.expected: Critical cache manifests should be generated or validated automatically.
findings.risk: Offline/runtime drift and incomplete cache updates.
findings.fix_hint: Generate precache manifest during build or add automated cache-manifest consistency checks.
